definition: to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Chandler wants Monica to wear the earings he gave her.
sentences.chinese: 钱德希望莫妮卡戴上他送的耳环。

sentences.english: We still remember last year, when the first scene scarf to wear it?
sentences.chinese: 还记得我们上一年级时，第一次戴上领巾时的情景吗？

sentences.english: You get up in the morning and put on your glasses, snap on the radio, and grab the morning paper.
sentences.chinese: 你在早上醒来，戴上眼镜，打开收音机，拿起早报。

sentences.english: Multimode and silk aram put on the first bought ring, and was agreed.
sentences.chinese: 多模和丝兰戴上了最初买的戒指，并商定娶亲。

sentences.english: He clapped his hat on angrily and walked out.
sentences.chinese: 他气冲冲地急忙戴上帽子走出去了。

sentences.english: She took the watch from Cerita and put it on.
sentences.chinese: 她向谢莉妲拿过来手表，而且戴上。

sentences.english: Draw on the eyepatch to have a good sleep.
sentences.chinese: 将眼罩戴上，美美地睡上一觉。

sentences.english: The taking of the veil or the frock is a suicide paid for with eternity.
sentences.chinese: 戴上面纱或穿上僧衣是一种取得永生的自杀。

sentences.english: It's a bit nippy today; you'd better wear your scarf.
sentences.chinese: 今天有点儿凉，你最好戴上你的围巾。

sentences.english: I was worried about being handcuffed and led out of the shop in front of my customers.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕戴上手铐在顾客面前被带出餐馆。

sentences.english: As she placed one in her left eye she halted and stared into the mirror intently.
sentences.chinese: 她左眼戴上隐形眼镜，对着镜子仔细地端详。

sentences.english: Li Ming put on his scarf, hat and mittens , too.
sentences.chinese: 李明也围上了他的围巾，戴上了帽子和手套。

sentences.english: For tinnitus, protection like ear plugs or ear defenders help.
sentences.chinese: 戴上耳塞或者护耳器等保护措施可以防止耳鸣。

sentences.english: We had a nightcap before bedtime to round off a perfect day.
sentences.chinese: 我们戴上睡帽上床睡觉，一天的生活结束了。

sentences.english: Many people suffered, wear the choic crown.
sentences.chinese: 许多人承受了，戴上了荆冠。

sentences.english: I have seen the freest among you wear their freedom as a yoke and a handcuff.
sentences.chinese: 我曾看见你们之中最自由者，把自由像枷铐似的戴上。

definition: to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
to take off/to remove (one's hat, a door from its hinges etc)/to pick (a piece of fruit from a tree etc)/(sports) to pick off (a rebound etc)
to put on/to wear (mouthguard, contact lenses, hearing aid etc)
